titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I wrote a short address for the children's service, & then shewed Lord
over the house, & the cathedral. He was a vigourous & conscientious visitor, & mounted the tower of the Cathedral. The children's carol service at 3 p.m. was a pleasing service.

alone of the canons resident was absent, & when I met him & taxed him with the fact, he feigned to think that he was not intended to be present!! Then I drafted a letter about the Commemoration Service on the 29
inst: & took it across to Hughes for the printer. I wrote to Inge on the same subject. Linetta began to teach me Italian, but it is in the last degree improbable that I shall persist with it.
